intro: Paraphlomis shunchangensis, commonly known as the Shunchang skullcap, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests.
